```sh
      ufw [options] command [parameters] 

```

```sh
      # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt update && sudo apt install ufw

# Check if UFW is installed
which ufw 

```

```sh
      # Enable UFW
sudo ufw enable

# Disable UFW
sudo ufw disable

# Check UFW status
sudo ufw status
sudo ufw status verbose
sudo ufw status numbered 

```

```sh
      # Allow SSH (port 22)
sudo ufw allow 22
sudo ufw allow ssh

# Allow HTTP (port 80)
sudo ufw allow 80
sudo ufw allow http

# Allow HTTPS (port 443)
sudo ufw allow 443
sudo ufw allow https

# Allow custom port
sudo ufw allow 8080 

```

```sh
      # Deny port 80
sudo ufw deny 80

# Deny SSH from specific IP
sudo ufw deny from 192.168.1.100 to any port 22 

```

```sh
      # Allow common services
sudo ufw allow ssh
sudo ufw allow http
sudo ufw allow https
sudo ufw allow ftp
sudo ufw allow smtp 

```

```sh
      # Allow port range
sudo ufw allow 1000:2000/tcp
sudo ufw allow 1000:2000/udp

# Allow specific protocol
sudo ufw allow 53/udp  # DNS
sudo ufw allow 53/tcp  # DNS over TCP 

```

```sh
      # Allow from specific IP
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.100

# Deny from specific IP
sudo ufw deny from 192.168.1.50

# Allow subnet
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.0/24 

```

```sh
      # Allow specific IP to SSH
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.100 to any port 22

# Allow subnet to web server
sudo ufw allow from 10.0.0.0/8 to any port 80 

```

```sh
      # Allow on specific interface
sudo ufw allow in on eth0 to any port 80

# Allow out on specific interface
sudo ufw allow out on eth1 to any port 443 

```

```sh
      # Show status and rules
sudo ufw status

# Show numbered rules
sudo ufw status numbered

# Show verbose status
sudo ufw status verbose 

```

```sh
      # Delete by rule number
sudo ufw delete 3

# Delete by specifying the rule
sudo ufw delete allow 80
sudo ufw delete allow from 192.168.1.100 

```

```sh
      # Insert rule at specific position
sudo ufw insert 1 allow from 192.168.1.0/24 

```

```sh
      # Set default policies
sudo ufw default deny incoming
sudo ufw default allow outgoing
sudo ufw default deny forward

# Check current defaults
sudo ufw status verbose 

```

```sh
      # List application profiles
sudo ufw app list

# Show profile info
sudo ufw app info OpenSSH
sudo ufw app info "Apache Full" 

```

```sh
      # Allow application
sudo ufw allow OpenSSH
sudo ufw allow "Apache Full"
sudo ufw allow "Nginx Full"

# Common application profiles
sudo ufw allow "OpenSSH"
sudo ufw allow "Apache"
sudo ufw allow "Apache Secure"
sudo ufw allow "Nginx HTTP"
sudo ufw allow "Nginx HTTPS"
sudo ufw allow "Nginx Full" 

```

```sh
      # Enable logging
sudo ufw logging on

# Set log level
sudo ufw logging low
sudo ufw logging medium
sudo ufw logging high

# Disable logging
sudo ufw logging off

# View logs
sudo tail -f /var/log/ufw.log 

```

```sh
      # Reset all rules to default
sudo ufw --force reset

# Reload UFW
sudo ufw reload 

```

```sh
      # Start with deny all
sudo ufw default deny incoming
sudo ufw default allow outgoing

# Only allow what's needed
sudo ufw allow ssh
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.0/24 to any port 80 

```

```sh
      # Limit SSH attempts (6 attempts in 30 seconds)
sudo ufw limit ssh

# Allow SSH only from specific networks
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.0/24 to any port 22
sudo ufw deny ssh 

```
